How to Install dbconfig-sqlite on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • dbconfig-sqlite

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install dbconfig-sqlite on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing dbconfig-sqlite on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall dbconfig-sqlite in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install dbconfig-sqlite, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install dbconfig-sqlite Using apt

To install dbconfig-sqlite in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install dbconfig-sqlite using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install dbconfig-sqlite

The installation of dbconfig-sqlite might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install dbconfig-sqlite Using apt-get

To install dbconfig-sqlite using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install dbconfig-sqlite.

sudo apt-get -y install dbconfig-sqlite

Install dbconfig-sqlite Using Synaptic

To install dbconfig-sqlite using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install dbconfig-sqlite on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for dbconfig-sqlite. This will display the dbconfig-sqlite package in the package window, now to install dbconfig-sqlite, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the dbconfig-sqlite package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of dbconfig-sqlite.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install dbconfig-sqlite Using aptitude

To install dbconfig-sqlite on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of dbconfig-sqlite.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install dbconfig-sqlite using the command aptitude install dbconfig-sqlite.

sudo aptitude -y install dbconfig-sqlite

How to Upgrade dbconfig-sqlite on debian

If you want to upgrade the dbconfig-sqlite package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade dbconfig-sqlite using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade dbconfig-sqlite to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade dbconfig-sqlite.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade dbconfig-sqlite sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade dbconfig-sqlite

Upgrade dbconfig-sqlite using Aptitude

To upgrade dbconfig-sqlite using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade dbconfig-sqlite.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade dbconfig-sqlite

Upgrade dbconfig-sqlite using Synaptic

To upgrade dbconfig-sqlite using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for dbconfig-sqlite, now right-click dbconfig-sqlite, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade dbconfig-sqlite just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall dbconfig-sqlite on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall dbconfig-sqlite from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just dbconfig-sqlite, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove dbconfig-sqlite

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of dbconfig-sqlite

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of dbconfig-sqlite you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge dbconfig-sqlite

Remove dbconfig-sqlite using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall dbconfig-sqlite using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for dbconfig-sqlite, right-click the dbconfig-sqlite package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall dbconfig-sqlite click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install dbconfig-sqlite on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade dbconfig-sqlite using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of dbconfig-sqlite then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
